newsitem.title: USA: Baltimore sees 646 MW coal unit up Oct 21.
newsitem.headline: Baltimore sees 646 MW coal unit up Oct 21.

text.p: Baltimore Gas & Electric Co (BGE) said Tuesday it expected its 646 MW coal-fired Brandon Shores unit 2 to resume operation next month after being shut more than a week ago for seasonal maintenance,
"It went down September 13. Everything's on target for its return on October 21," the spokesman said, adding the adjoining 645 MW unit 1 remained in service.
The Brandon Shores facility is located in metropolitan Baltimore, in Anne Arundael County. Both units account for approximately 20 percent of the BGE's installed generating capacity.
Baltimore Gas & Electric is the operator and sole owner of Brandon Shores.
